bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Mrs. Mason Young, January 21, 1901

div1.p: Kean discusses the health of friends back in the United States. He includes a satirical paragraph on the health of acquaintances.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Mrs. Mason Young, January 21, 1901
div1.opener:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT
OF HAVANA AND PINAR DEL RIO,
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
Columbia Bks.
Jan. 21, 1901.
My dear Gran
div1.p:
Your letter of the 16th
came today and brought
us much comfort by the
good news that George
had passed his crisis
and was recovering-
I had been consoling Louise
with the assurance that
it must have passed, &
as we had had no cable
he must be doing well,
but the assurance of the
fact is much better
than the supposition.

I think George will be
very comfortable and run
no risks in the Maes-
tranza- There are evident-
ly no loaded mosquitoes
there, as nothing happens
to the fifty or more non-
immunes who make their
home there- Altho it is
near the harbor George
will not find either the
air or the building damp
at this season, which is
you remember the beginning
of the dry season in Cuba
We will be delighted to
see the old fellow &
Molly in Cuba, and I
only wish we had some
place to put them so we could have a
visit from them- But we can eat them
if we cant sleep them & the drives to
the Barracks & back will be fine for
the invalid when he gets stronger- I
have such a nice carriage & team too
now- I wish I had had it a year ago
when you were with us-

I will put my good friend the Chief
Sanitary Officer of Havana on guard
over George to see that no mosquito, unless
per chance a harmless “pungens” comes
nigh his dwelling, but what can even
this high official, even tho he is next
door do for Georgie if his charming
hostess has the itch! I would recom-
mend that he shake hands with himself
like George Francis Frain- But I saw
Gertrude at the Drum's reception Saturday
and she gave no ocular evidence of para-
sitic cutaneous irritation, She may at
some time have itched but I dont think
she could have had the itch - and that
swell nurse! Parish the thought! We are
all very well indeed & I am boning for my exam.
Love to George & Moll when you see them or write-

The beautiful Bobbie is in short dresses with red kid shoes & is
much admired. With much love
